column4: does anybody know of a relatively easy way of transfering files from my ubuntu machine to my Samsung galaxy s3 sd card?
ftp is possible but not ideal. the problem is android 4.04 uses MTP instead of USM
i don't have an sd card reader on my computer or i would use that?
what about adb? would a push command work?
i get that dude. i have the usb hooked up. But Samsung Gs3 uses mtp so i can't transfer without gMTP 1.3.3 which i doin't have.
i don't have a tablet.
yeah.
i don't want to use ftp because of data.
If you have 64 bit. https://launchpad.net/~quadrispro/+archive/backports/+build/3580967
Thanks so much wilee-nilee
Data charges phix
here is the actual ppa. https://launchpad.net/~quadrispro/+archive/backports
that allready worked it's done. thanks again wilee-nilee
not if im using a usb
No problem I have a nexus 7 that was fine with the stock gMTP, lets see how this one works here.
no wireless.
there is no mass storage mode phix just MTP
obviously you don't kow what's going on here yekoms.
yeah but my motherboard doesn't
have you ever had a mp3 or phone that only uses mtp, not ums?
media transfer protocol
yeah.
IT WORKED wilee-nilee!
